title: Best MacBook Pro deals this month
content:
Macworld

If you are looking to buy a new MacBook Pro you don’t have to pay full price. Our team of Apple experts search the web all year round for the top deals, offers and discounts for the MacBook Pro – seeking out the best money-off offers to save you time.

Apple announced 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pro models with M2 Pro and M2 Max chips in January 2023. These new MacBook Pro went on sale on Tuesday, January 24, 2023 and we are already seeing discounts–Amazon in the U.S. and KRCS in the U.K. both have money off (more details below), but we don’t expect to see huge discounts on these models for a while.

In the meantime though, you may get a great deal on one of the older M1 Pro or M1 Mac MacBook Pro models that launched in 2021 as retailers clear out stock. For example, you can save you can get $400 off the original price of a 16-inch MacBook Pro at Amazon U.S. and £450 off the original price of a 16-inch MacBook Pro at Amazon U.K. Just note that Apple outside the U.S. Apple has upped prices for the new MacBook Pro range, which means that the prices of the older models will look even more attractive.

In this article we also run through some tips and explain Apple’s pricing structure, so that you can be sure you are getting the best discount available.

Here we are focused on the MacBook Pro, but there are some great deals for the MacBook Air too. The MacBook Air and the 13in MacBook Pro have a lot in common, so you might also be interested in reading our MacBook Air deals article as well. And make sure you check out our complete round-up of the best Apple deals we’ve seen.

Below you will find price comparison tables that show the best prices right now for each standard model of MacBook Pro. You will also find deals on MacBooks that Apple has now discontinued, as long as stockists still have them available. If you are struggling to find a reseller that has the MacBook Pro in stock read this: Where is the MacBook Pro in stock?

Best MacBook Pro deals right now

Here are some of the best deals we are seeing right now:

Best U.S. MacBook Pro deals

The new MacBook Pros started shipping on Tuesday, January 24, but you can already save at Amazon!

  • Amazon: 14-inch, 10/16-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 512GB: $1,899 ($100 off)
  • Amazon: 14-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 1TB: $2,435.94 ($63.06 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 512GB: $2,449.99 ($49.01 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 1TB: $2,648.95 ($51 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/38-core M2 Max MacBook Pro, 1TB: $3,435.94 ($63 off)

Best U.K. MacBook Pro deals

In the U.K. Amazon is also discounting the M2 Pro and M2 Mac MacBook Pro. There are discounts on every model including:

  • Amazon: 14-inch, 10/16-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro,512GB: £1,983.97 (£165 off)
  • Amazon: 14-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 1TB: £2,492.97 (£206.03 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 512GB: £2,492.97 (£206.03 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/19-core M2 Pro MacBook Pro, 1TB: £2,674.97 (£220.03 off)
  • Amazon: 16-inch 12/38-core M2 Max MacBook Pro, 1TB: £3,462.97 (£286 off)
  • Amazon: M2 13-inch MacBook Pro 256GB: £1,225 (£124 off). Same deal in AO, Currys and John Lewis
  • Amazon: M2 13-inch MacBook Pro 512GB: £1,399 (£150 off).

If you don’t mind buying an older MacBook Pro, there’s an 2020 MacBook Pro M1, 512GB for £1,199 at Amazon U.K. That model was £1,499, so it’s £300 off as part of Amazon U.K.’s spring sale.

MacBook Pro: What you need to know

There are three different MacBook Pro sizes: the 13-, 14- and 16-inch models. The 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pro were updated with M2 Pro and M2 Max chips in January 2023, and a 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip went on sale on June 17, 2022. You may be able to get some good deals on the discontinued M1, M1 Pro and M1 Max models as resellers clear out old stock–scroll to the bottom of this article to check prices for the discontinued models.

For more information read our reviews of the M2 MacBook Pro and the 2023 16in MacBook Pro. We also have reviews of the 2021 16in MacBook Pro and 14in MacBook Pro. For more help choosing the best Apple laptop read our buying guide where we cover all the models. We also have a Mac buying guide that covers the whole range. We also explain the differences between the MacBook Air and Pro.

Some of the deals below–e.g. those from Backmarket if you are in the U.S.–are refurbished, so be sure to double check in case the deal isn’t as good as it looks.

Where to buy a MacBook Pro

There are limited stocks leading to some shipping delays, but you can find the MacBook Pro on sale at various locations. You could buy a MacBook Pro directly from Apple, or at stores and Apple Premium Resellers around the world – many of whom offer discounts on new and old Macs, so it’s worth shopping around. You can find out where the MacBook Pro is in stock or read our Where to buy a Mac article for more advice.

One benefit of buying from Apple is you could trade in your old Mac and get money off. We have an article explaining  How to get money off with Apple’s trade-in program.

We recommend the following resellers in the US and UK:

U.S. retailers

  • Apple Store
  • Apple Education Store
  • Amazon
  • B&H Photo
  • Best Buy
  • Walmart
  • Adorama

U.K. retailers

  • Apple Store
  • Apple Education Store
  • Amazon
  • AO.com
  • BT Shop
  • Currys
  • Ebuyer
  • John Lewis
  • Laptops Direct
  • Very

Additionally, Apple has a number of Apple Premium Resellers in the U.K. who stock Macs and offer other services:

  • KRCS
  • Insight
  • iStore
  • Select
  • Western Computer
  • Jigsaw

Best MacBook Pro refurbished deals

While Apple rarely discounts new Macs, from time to time there are some excellent deals to be had in Apple’s Refurbished Store. The Macs in Apple’s refurbished store may be ex-display stock, or they may have been returned to Apple due to a fault, but they are fully reconditioned now and come with a full year’s warranty. Read about buying a refurbished Mac. It’s not only Apple that sells refurbished Macs, but Apple does offer some great incentives to buy from Apple’s Refurbished Store, so we do recommend taking a look there for great MacBook Pro deals.

We often see the cheaper M1 MacBook Pro on sale on the refurbished store, which means you could get the 13.3-inch MacBook Pro Apple M1 Chip with 8‑Core CPU and 8‑Core GPU with 256GB SSD for just £1,099/$1,099. A saving of £200/$200.

There are often deals for refurbished MacBook Pro – but these tend to sell out quickly so we recommend you check often. Most of the deals we have seen are for the Intel-powered models rather than M1 or M2-series Macs. In the UK watch this page and the US Refurb Store page is here.

In the U.S.:

  • Apple Refurb: M1 13-inch MacBook Pro, 8-core GPU, 256GB: $1,059 (£190 off)
  • Apple Refurb: M2 13-inch MacBook Pro, 10-core GPU, 256GB: $1,169 (£130 off)
  • Apple Refurb: M1 Pro, 14-inch MacBook Pro, 14-core GPU, 256GB: $1,539 (£360 off)
  • Apple Refurb: M1 Pro, 14-inch MacBook Pro, 16-core GPU, 256GB: $1,929 (£470 off)
  • Apple Refurb: M1 Pro, 16-inch MacBook Pro, 16-core GPU, 256GB: $1,929 (£370 off)
  • Apple Refurb: M1 Pro, 16-inch MacBook Pro, 16-core GPU, 512GB: $2,079 (£420 off)

In the U.K.:

  • Apple Refurb: M2 13-inch MacBook Pro 256GB: £1,209 (£140 off)

Amazon also has a certified refurbished store for Apple products but we would advise against buying any products that are older than five years – most of the products we see on the Amazon refurbished store are unfortunately very old. Another place to look is BackMarket US and BackMarket UK, which sells refurbished Macs and other Apple products.

Find the latest Apple refurbished deals here. If you are considering buying a second hand Mac read: Should I buy a second hand Mac?

Apple, Mac
